aboutSection.title: About
aboutSection.mobileParagraph: Developer for over 2 years. As a mobile developer, I dedicated myself to developing my own company on Google Play from scratch, until the publication of the Media Timer. Now, I am looking to build other projects to gain more experience, such as the new application under development Star T-Shirts. With the objective to get an opportunity in the application market using React Native.
aboutSection.frontEndParagraph: As a front-end developer, I currently work on a project with hundreds of clients, the SG Master Web system, where me and my front-end team developed the project from scratch, facing several challenges. I also have personal projects, where I always seek to challenge myself to learn something new.
aboutSection.aboutMeParagraph: Lastly, I am a determined person, that have the objective to constantly improve. I don't like fights, trying always to be peaceful. I also, try to learn from others and help as much as possible.

StarTShirts.title: Star T-Shirts
StarTShirts.about: Fictitious e-commerce application, made only for t-shirts.
challengesList: Unique design in Figma.
First project without Expo, only React Native CLI.
Native module to display the Splash Screen, written with Kotlin.
React Navigation for Routes.
The project structure has created as it was a real product.
Form screens with React Hook Form, and has Zod validations.
Componentization of most used elements.
Situational alerts developed from scratch, generated through global state.

MediaTimer.title: Media Timer
MediaTimer.about: Timer application, with the objective to solve a personal problem.

challengesList.development: Project with more than 1 year of development.
challengesList.publishing: Publishing to Google Play in production.
challengesList.sounds: Ability to choose sounds from your phone or app and history of sounds from your phone.
challengesList.marketing: Marketing about the project in the company's LinkedIn.
challengesList.languages: App in English/US and Portuguese/BR (depends on your device language) with i18next.
challengesList.themes: Dark and white theme, I created a React Context to manage this state.
challengesList.notAllowedThemeChanges: By native code, I have not allowed cell phones (for example Xiaomi) to change the theme colors for others.
challengesList.accessibility: I tested accessibility and made to not being possible to change the size of texts by the user's cell phone.
challengesList.timerLogic: The timer logic was complex to develop, since I created it without a library.
challengesList.notification: Notification showing the status of the application and a custom icon for it (imported by Android Studio).
challengesList.expoVersion: I have updated the Expo SDK version to a newer one.
challengesList.localStorage: The chosen theme, if the app she can alert at the end of the timer and the history of sounds, are saved in the application cache (local storage).

Ebooks.title: E-books
Ebooks.about: Book research website, which was used for the selection process test that made me to being hired at SGBr® Sistemas.
challengesList: I developed the project in 1 week and a few days.
Had to learn the technologies: Vue, Pinia and Tailwind in the same time.
Used Pinia for global state.
Data treatment and validations when searching for the book in case of error or success.
I used the Google API to search for books.
Accessibility test.
Unique design in Figma.
Favorites by local storage.
Each book can be favorite or removed by the button on the card, both in the favorite tab and on the main page.
Card images can be clicked to display them in a larger size.
Responsive website, can be used on mobile and computer.
Text treatment of the cards of books.

Portfolio.title: Portfolio
Portfolio.about: My personal page, which is the showcase of my career, was developed and still receives updates to provide security for those who want to hire me.
challengesList: Unique design in Figma.
Responsive website, can be used on mobile and computer.
Accessibility test.
Header links are indicated by a color change, depending on the section you are.

Achievements section functionality, where you click on an achievement, and it opens one way on computer and another on mobile, also allowing you to see the image of the achievement in a larger size and the more details button.
Privacy policy page about the Media Timer app.
All texts are designed to tell about my experience and provide security to the client or recruiter.
Website in English/US and Portuguese/BR (depends on your device language) with i18next.
After clicking on the LinkedIn button in the contact section, it ends up taking you to the “Thank You” screen that redirects to LinkedIn.

GodOfWar.title: God Of War E-commerce
GodOfWar.about: Fictional e-commerce project themed around the game God of War: Ragnarök.
challengesList: Unique design in Figma.
Carousel of items without a library, developed from scratch and responsive.
Responsive website, can be used on mobile and computer.
Cart and products by local storage.
Accessibility test.
Fictitious cart screen with the products you chose.
Header hides when scrolling down and expands when scrolling up.
Using React's Context for global state.

SGBrSistemas.about: I work on the front-end team, and we have developed the new SG Master Web system.

challengesList.landingPage: Creation and maintenance of the Web system Landing Page.
challengesList.developmentWebSystem: Development and maintenance of the new SG Master Web system.
challengesList.undoChanges: Correction of pages with the undo changes button (this is a button that appears in the action bar that returns the form values ​​to their initial state, whether editing or registration).
challengesList.usersPermissions: Implementation of the new users permissions. Where I had to develop two form pages, one for profiles and other for users. I also changed all system permissions to the new ones, created and maintained the permissions component, and developed to work with the undo changes button.
challengesList.togetherBackend: Working together with the back-end team, passing on errors and necessary changes of the project.
challengesList.newFilters: Implementation of new back-end V2 filters for selects of the old model and new model on the front-end.
challengesList.refactoringPages: Refactoring pages from the old template to the new template.
challengesList.components: Development of components and reusable utility files.
challengesList.customizationQuasar: Customization of selects, inputs and other Quasar components via CSS file, making the design different from the framework's default. To make these changes, I had to use the DevTools inspector a lot.
challengesList.taxDocuments: Implementation of margins and sending of tax documents by email, together with the back-end team. Furthermore, in each module and in the email sending settings, you can change the footer message sent in the email in a WYSIWYG editor.

challengesList.adMob: I had to learn about AdMob, to place advertisement in apps.
challengesList.issuesProjects: Handle privacy policy and other Google issues related to the projects.
